我一直在耐心地等待水位到達涼亭的二樓。 這是一種罕見的事件，僅在幾年內會發生一次，並且一年內只持續幾天。
這個夏天連續下了好幾場豪大雨，所以我們很幸運能夠在天時地利的時間到達正確的地方，終於能夠跳出著名的大埔六角涼亭。
☺

pavilion. It's a rare event that only happens once over few years, and only for
a few days of the year. It rained a ton this summer, so we were lucky enough to
be in the right place at the right time, and finally be able to jump off the
famous hexagon pavilion.

小錦屏溫泉是台灣北部最容易接近的野生溪溫泉之一。 它不是在很深的山脈，也不需要渡溯河或技術性健行。 您無需過河即可到達溫泉。
這使其成為一個非常受歡迎的周末旅遊地，也是泡湯的好地方。 儘管在那裡修建了一條道路，以方便吊橋的建造，但是對於大多數汽車來說，到達道路底部仍然是困難的。
建議將車停在山頂或去溫泉路中間的一半處，然後再走剩下的路。 路底部的區域非常寬，並且可以容納很多人。 附近有幾個漂亮的瀑布，步行即可到達。

Xiaojinping is one of the most accessible wild hot springs in North Taiwan. It's
not very deep into the mountains, and there is no river tracing or technical
hiking required. You don't need to cross a river to get to the hot spring. This
makes it a very popular weekend destination and a great place to soak in a hot
spring. Although a road was built there to facilitate the construction of a
suspension bridge, it will still be difficult for most cars to reach the bottom.
It's recommended to park at the top of the hill or half way down to the hot
springs, and then walk the rest of the way. The area at the bottom is very wide,
and there is room to accommodate a lot of people. Nearby there are several nice
waterfalls within walking distance.

許多人可能知道，澳大利亞各地正處炙熱大火中。它已經燒毀了大約台灣兩倍的面積。
小火是澳大利亞生態的自然組成一部分，但這種大火是前所未有的。這不是意外事故或偶然發生的事件。這場大火發生的條件已經建立了多年，主要因素是氣候變化。氣候變化加劇了天氣事件，使其更具災難性。
當我們為澳大利亞人民和那裡的野生動植物的安全祈禱，並希望他們早日康復時，我們還應該花點時間思考這場危機的含義以及其根源。因為除非我們更改當前做法，否則它可能在任何地方發生。氣候變化不僅僅是澳大利亞的問題。世界各地成千上萬人面臨著火災，乾旱，洪水，海平面上升，強烈風暴以及天氣和農作物產量的變化。我們還受到氣候變化的影響。我們也是氣候變化的貢獻者。
因此，儘管我對台灣的政治了解不多，因此無法建議您應該投票給誰，但我只想對所有人說，當您投票時，請考慮一下氣候因素。您選出的各位官員代表需要認真對待此問題。因為影響很嚴重。而且它也剛剛開始。
 

 
另外投票是權利也是義務，不論你投給誰，請大家善用你的權利，也尊重人民應盡的義務，1/11星期六，別忘記要去投票！！！我們台灣未來往哪個方向前進，你的一票很重要！！！
🔥🌲🔥🌳🔥🌵
As many of you probably know, Australia is on fire. It’s already burned an area
roughly double the size of Taiwan. Small fires are a natural part of Australia’s
ecology, but fires on this scale are unprecedented. It’s not a freak accident or
random occurrence. The conditions for this fire have been building for years,
and a major factor is climate change. Climate change is exacerbating weather
events and making them more catastrophic. While we pray for the safety of the
Australian people and the wildlife there, and wish them a speedy recovery, we
should also take the time to reflect on what this crisis means, and what are the
causes of it. Because unless we change our current path, this could be anywhere.
Climate change isn’t just an Australian problem. Hundreds of millions of people
around the world are faced with fires, droughts, floods, rising sea levels,
stronger storms, and changes in weather and crop yields. We are also affected by
climate change. We are also contributors to climate change. So while I don’t
know too much about politics in Taiwan, and so can give no recommendation on who
you should vote for, I just want to say to everyone that when you do cast your
vote, consider the climate. Demand from your representatives to take this issue
seriously. Because it is serious. And it’s also just getting started.

 For a limited time we are in for a very special treat. The water levels at Dapu
Lakeside Park are nearly to the max. You can drive right up to the edge of the
lake, and the forest becomes a mystical wetlands, with the wooden camping
platforms just barely on the lakes edge. The Hexagon Pavilion also becomes an
island, and for a short while, we get to jump off the third floor.

 Currently the lake stands at 229.52 meters, just half a meter shy of the
maximum 230. Real time water level information can be checked at this link: 
https://eng.wra.gov.tw/

 When I visited on Thursday, the water levels were 229.34. The water on the 2nd
floor of the pavilion was ankle deep, and the water over the edge was plenty
deep for jumping into, and would be fine until about 229 meters, or up to the
last stairs to the 2nd floor of the Hexagon Pavilion. 

 As always though, it's important to physically swim out and check before you
jump anyway. It will be convenient to check as well, since just getting to the
pavilion when the water levels are above 229 requires a 150 meter swim anyway. 

 There is a video coming soon, but I wanted to go ahead and post this first,
because depending on the rains, the water levels may go back down soon. You can
find more information and a map here.

我終於完成了21公里的秀姑巒溪漂漂河，真是太棒了。 河流的漂流部分可分為上半部（瑞穗至奇美）和下半部（奇美至溪卜蘭）兩部分。
上半部溪流有點長，在這裡的泛舟等級只有一個大的初學者II級。 下半部溪流較短，並且有更多的急流，但這些急流都很小。
在我看來，下半部分更漂亮，所以如果你的時間有限，就做這個部分。 但是，總體來說兩個部分都非常好。 如果您的技巧很好,在河流最快的地方總行程大約需要4個小時。
如果你是用像我划的胖黃鴨，它就會花費更久的時間。 您可以在此影片中觀看河流的樣子：

(Qimei to Xibolan). The upper part is is a little bit longer, and only has 1
large class II rapid at this water level. The lower part is shorter, and and has
more rapids, all of which are fairly small. In my opinion, the lower section is
more beautiful, so if your time is limited do that one. However, both are very
nice. If you're good at staying in the fastest parts of the river, the total
trip should take about 4 hours. If you're in a fat duck though, it's going to
take you a lot longer. You can see what the river looks like in this video link
above, and get more info, as well as a detailed map of access points along the
river on my website.

Hey Taiwan. I just got back from a Huandao with Kunhe. The goal of our trip was
to explore and map out some new waterfalls on the east, east coast. The
mountains that are facing the sea. Everyone there are not many waterfalls on the
ocean side, but we set out to prove them wrong, and also check out a few ocean
hotspots. We did find waterfalls! And each one will be nicer than the last. Here
is the first one from the trip, Wangwang Waterfall. It’s not easy to get to, if
it was easy it would already be on the map with a path to it. I’m working on the
maps now, and will publish about 10 new places over the next several weeks, and
also be posting videos from the trip on youtube. Please make sure to subscribe
there and click on the bell to make sure you get the notifications for new
videos.
